oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVE-DRIVEN COASTAL DYNAMICS: CAN WE RELY ON PHASE-RESOLVING MODELS?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Azouri, Assaf
Roeber, Volker
Guiles, Martin David
Iwamoto, Melissa
Owens, Tara
Becker, Janet
Luther, Douglas S
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Wave simulations from two Boussinesq-type models: BOSZ (Roeber & Cheung, 2012) and FUNWAVE (Shi et al., 2012), and a non-hydrostatic model: XBeach (Roelvink et al., 2009), are compared to observational data in a harbor and along the exposed coast of northwest O'ahu Island, Hawai'i, under highly energetic sea/swell forcing conditions. In the present comparison we attempt to address whether the models can (i) reproduce the observed spectra at different locations over a fringing reef and inside a harbor, and; (ii) draw a consistent 2-dimensional picture of the gravity and IG wave fields throughout the computational domain.Recorded Presentation from the vICCE (YouTube Link): https://youtu.be/kbbOT0ZpnEo
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 36v (2020): Proceedings of virtual Conference on Coastal Engineering, 2020; waves.45
